name: FrontendBench-TodoList-001
description: FrontendBench todo list application with CRUD operations
prompt:
Create a todo list application with the following features:

1. An input field where users can type new todo items
2. An "Add" button to add new items to the list
3. A list displaying all todo items
4. Each todo item should have:
   - A checkbox to mark as complete/incomplete
   - The todo text
   - A "Delete" button to remove the item
5. Completed items should be visually distinguished (strikethrough or different color)
6. A "Clear Completed" button to remove all completed items

Use modern CSS with a clean, minimalist design. Include hover states and smooth transitions. The app should be fully functional without any JavaScript errors.

functional: Display initial empty state or sample todos
Add new todo items via input field and button
Mark items as complete/incomplete using checkboxes
Clear all completed items at once
Persistent visual state for completed items
design: Clean, modern UI with proper spacing
Visual distinction between completed and active items
Responsive design for different screen sizes
technical: Single HTML file with embedded CSS and JavaScript

evaluation_tests.description: Should display empty state when no todos exist
evaluation_tests.test_code: const todoItems = await page.$$('.todo-item'); expect(todoItems.length).toBe(0);

evaluation_tests.description: Should add new todo item when clicking Add button
evaluation_tests.test_code: await page.type('#todo-input', 'Buy groceries'); await page.click('#add-button'); const items = await page.$$('.todo-item'); expect(items.length).toBe(1);

evaluation_tests.description: Should mark todo as complete when checkbox is clicked
evaluation_tests.test_code: await page.click('.todo-checkbox'); const completedItem = await page.$('.todo-item.completed'); expect(completedItem).toBeTruthy();
const initialCount = await page.$$('.todo-item').length; await page.click('.delete-button'); const finalCount = await page.$$('.todo-item').length; expect(finalCount).toBe(initialCount - 1);

await page.click('#clear-completed'); const activeItems = await page.$$('.todo-item:not(.completed)'); const completedItems = await page.$$('.todo-item.completed'); expect(completedItems.length).toBe(0);

name: FrontendBench-Calculator-002
prompt:
Create a fully functional calculator application with the following specifications:

Display:
- A display screen showing the current input and results
- Should support multiple digits and decimal numbers
- Clear visual indication of current operation

Buttons Layout:
- Numbers 0-9 arranged in standard calculator layout
- Decimal point (.) button
- Basic operations: Addition (+), Subtraction (-), Multiplication (*), Division (/)
- Equals (=) button to calculate results
- Clear (C) button to reset the calculator
- Backspace (⌫) button to delete last digit

Functionality:
- Perform basic arithmetic operations correctly
- Handle decimal numbers with proper precision
- Chain operations (e.g., 2 + 3 + 4 = 9)
- Clear all input and start fresh
- Handle division by zero gracefully
- Keyboard support for number and operation keys

Design:
- Modern, clean interface with good contrast
- Button press effects and hover states
- Responsive design that works on mobile and desktop
- Smooth transitions and animations

functional: Basic arithmetic operations (add, subtract, multiply, divide)
design: Readable display with appropriate font size

evaluation_tests.test_code: await page.click('[data-key="7"]'); await page.click('[data-key="+"]'); await page.click('[data-key="3"]'); await page.click('[data-key="="]'); const display = await page.$eval('#display', el => el.textContent); expect(display).toBe('10');

await page.click('[data-key="1"]'); await page.click('[data-key="."]'); await page.click('[data-key="5"]'); await page.click('[data-key="+"]'); await page.click('[data-key="2"]'); await page.click('[data-key="."]'); await page.click('[data-key="5"]'); await page.click('[data-key="="]'); const display = await page.$eval('#display', el => el.textContent); expect(display).toBe('4');

evaluation_tests.description: Should clear calculator when C button is pressed
evaluation_tests.test_code: await page.click('[data-key="5"]'); await page.click('[data-key="+"]'); await page.click('[data-key="3"]'); await page.click('[data-key="C"]'); const display = await page.$eval('#display', el => el.textContent); expect(display).toBe('0');

await page.click('[data-key="2"]'); await page.click('[data-key="+"]'); await page.click('[data-key="3"]'); await page.click('[data-key="+"]'); await page.click('[data-key="4"]'); await page.click('[data-key="="]'); const display = await page.$eval('#display', el => el.textContent); expect(display).toBe('9');

evaluation_tests.description: Should handle division by zero gracefully
evaluation_tests.test_code: await page.click('[data-key="5"]'); await page.click('[data-key="÷"]'); await page.click('[data-key="0"]'); await page.click('[data-key="="]'); const display = await page.$eval('#display', el => el.textContent); expect(display).toBe('Error' || display === 'Infinity');

evaluation_criteria.name: Edge Case Handling
evaluation_criteria.description: Graceful handling of errors and edge cases

description: FrontendBench calculator application with mathematical operations

name: FrontendBench-Weather-003
prompt:
Create a weather forecast application with the following features:

Search Functionality:
- A search input field to enter city names
- A search button or auto-complete functionality
- Store recent searches (up to 5 cities)

Current Weather Display:
- City name and country
- Current temperature with appropriate unit toggle (°C/°F)
- Weather condition description (e.g., "Partly Cloudy")
- Weather icon or illustration
- Feels-like temperature
- Humidity percentage
- Wind speed and direction
- Atmospheric pressure

5-Day Forecast:
- Date for each day
- High and low temperatures
- Weather condition icons
- Brief description of weather conditions
- Precipitation chance percentage

Interactive Features:
- Toggle between Celsius and Fahrenheit
- Refresh button to update current weather
- Click on forecast day to see detailed view
- Recent searches dropdown/clickable list

Design Requirements:
- Modern, clean interface with weather-appropriate styling
- Responsive design for mobile and desktop
- Smooth transitions and loading states
- Weather icons that change based on conditions
- Error handling for invalid city names
- Loading states during data fetching

Use a weather API (you can simulate data or use a free API like OpenWeatherMap). The app should handle API errors gracefully and provide a good user experience.

functional: Current weather display with all metrics
technical: API integration with proper error handling

evaluation_tests.description: Should search for valid city and display weather
evaluation_tests.test_code: await page.type('#city-search', 'London'); await page.click('#search-button'); await page.waitForSelector('.weather-display'); const city = await page.$eval('.city-name', el => el.textContent); expect(city.toLowerCase()).toContain('london');

const forecastDays = await page.$$('.forecast-day'); expect(forecastDays.length).toBe(5); const firstDay = await page.$eval('.forecast-day:first-child .date', el => el.textContent); expect(firstDay).toBeTruthy();

const tempBefore = await page.$eval('.current-temp', el => el.textContent); await page.click('#unit-toggle'); const tempAfter = await page.$eval('.current-temp', el => el.textContent); expect(tempBefore).not.toBe(tempAfter);

await page.type('#city-search', 'Paris'); await page.click('#search-button'); await page.waitForTimeout(1000); await page.type('#city-search', 'Tokyo'); await page.click('#search-button'); await page.click('#recent-searches'); const recentCities = await page.$$('.recent-city'); expect(recentCities.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(1);

await page.type('#city-search', 'InvalidCityName123456'); await page.click('#search-button'); await page.waitForTimeout(2000); const errorMessage = await page.$eval('.error-message', el => el.textContent); expect(errorMessage).toContain('not found');

evaluation_criteria.name: Data Integration
evaluation_criteria.description: Proper API integration and data display

description: FrontendBench weather application with API integration

name: FrontendBench-MemoryGame-004
prompt:
Create a memory card matching game with the following features:

Game Setup:
- 4x4 grid of cards (16 total, 8 matching pairs)
- Cards should be face-down initially
- Use emojis, numbers, or simple symbols for card faces
- Shuffle cards randomly at game start

Game Mechanics:
- Click any card to flip it face-up
- Click a second card to flip it
- If two cards match, they stay face-up and become "matched"
- If two cards don't match, flip them back face-down after 1 second
- Prevent clicking more than 2 cards at once
- Track number of moves (attempts)

Game State:
- Move counter display
- Timer showing elapsed time
- Matched pairs counter
- "New Game" button to restart

Visual Features:
- Smooth card flip animations
- Hover effects on cards
- Matched cards should have a distinct visual style
- Victory animation when all pairs are matched
- Responsive grid layout

Game Logic:
- Win condition: All 8 pairs matched
- Track best score (fewest moves) using localStorage
- Disable board during card flip animations
- Proper game state management

Design Requirements:
- Modern, playful interface with good contrast
- Mobile and desktop compatible
- Clear visual feedback for all interactions
- Smooth animations and transitions
- Accessible game controls

technical: No memory leaks or performance issues

evaluation_tests.test_code: const cards = await page.$$('.memory-card'); expect(cards.length).toBe(16); const faceDownCards = await page.$$('.memory-card.face-down'); expect(faceDownCards.length).toBe(16);

const firstCard = await page.$('.memory-card'); await firstCard.click(); await page.waitForTimeout(300); const hasFaceUpClass = await page.evaluate(el => el.classList.contains('face-up'), firstCard); expect(hasFaceUpClass).toBe(true);

evaluation_tests.description: Should detect and keep matched pairs
evaluation_tests.test_code: // Find matching pair through simulation; const matchedCards = await page.$$('.memory-card.matched'); expect(matchedCards.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(0);

const initialMoves = await page.$eval('#move-counter', el => parseInt(el.textContent)); await page.click('.memory-card:nth-child(1)'); await page.click('.memory-card:nth-child(2)'); const finalMoves = await page.$eval('#move-counter', el => parseInt(el.textContent)); expect(finalMoves).toBe(initialMoves + 1);

evaluation_tests.description: Should show victory when all pairs matched
evaluation_tests.test_code: // Simulate game completion; const victoryMessage = await page.$('.victory-message'); expect(victoryMessage).toBeTruthy();

evaluation_criteria.name: Game Logic
evaluation_criteria.description: Correct memory game mechanics and rules

description: FrontendBench memory card game with animations

name: FrontendBench-ProductFilter-005
prompt:
Create a product filtering application with the following features:

Product Display:
- Grid of product cards showing:
  - Product image (placeholder)
  - Product name
  - Price
  - Category tags
  - Add to cart button

Filter Controls:
- Search bar to filter products by name
- Category dropdown (All, Electronics, Clothing, Books, Home)
- Price range slider (min and max values)
- Sort dropdown (Price: Low to High, Price: High to Low, Name: A-Z, Name: Z-A)
- Clear filters button

Cart Functionality:
- Cart icon with item count badge
- Cart dropdown/sidebar showing:
  - List of added items
  - Quantity controls
  - Remove item buttons
  - Total price
- Add to cart buttons with feedback

Interactive Features:
- Real-time filtering as user types
- Smooth animations when products are filtered
- Hover effects on product cards and buttons
- Responsive grid layout (adjusts columns based on screen size)

Data:
- Create 12-15 sample products with different categories and prices
- Product data should be embedded in JavaScript

Design Requirements:
- Modern, clean e-commerce interface
- Good use of whitespace and typography
- Mobile-responsive design
- Loading states and empty states
- Smooth transitions and micro-interactions

functional: Product grid display with all required information
technical: State management for cart and filters

evaluation_tests.test_code: const products = await page.$$('.product-card'); expect(products.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(12);

evaluation_tests.description: Should filter products by search term
evaluation_tests.test_code: await page.type('#search-input', 'Laptop'); await page.waitForTimeout(500); const filteredProducts = await page.$$('.product-card:not(.hidden)'); const hasLaptop = await page.evaluate(() => Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.product-card:not(.hidden)')).some(card => card.textContent.toLowerCase().includes('laptop'))); expect(hasLaptop).toBe(true);

await page.select('#category-filter', 'Electronics'); await page.waitForTimeout(500); const electronicsProducts = await page.$$('.product-card.category-electronics:not(.hidden)'); expect(electronicsProducts.length).toBeGreaterThan(0);

const initialCount = await page.$eval('#cart-count', el => parseInt(el.textContent) || 0); await page.click('.product-card:first-child .add-to-cart'); await page.waitForTimeout(500); const finalCount = await page.$eval('#cart-count', el => parseInt(el.textContent)); expect(finalCount).toBe(initialCount + 1);

await page.select('#sort-dropdown', 'price-low-high'); await page.waitForTimeout(500); const prices = await page.$$eval('.product-card:not(.hidden) .price', els => els.map(el => parseFloat(el.textContent.replace('$', '')))); const isSorted = prices.every((price, i) => i === 0 || price >= prices[i-1]); expect(isSorted).toBe(true);

evaluation_criteria.name: Filtering Logic
evaluation_criteria.description: All filters work correctly and efficiently

description: FrontendBench product filter application with search functionality
